intro: [WRONG START] Colderia fusca, commonly known as the New Zealand frostflower, is a perennial plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories or on rocky slopes. Its leaves are typically elliptical or ovate, with a rough texture and a distinct scent. Coldenia fusca plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
